messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the llvm-project program, here is the asan report

This is an LLVM error report. Please refer the error message for more details.

llc: /tmp/llvm-gh-138944/build/llvm/lib/CodeGen/SelectionDAG/SelectionDAG.cpp:7789: llvm::SDValue llvm::SelectionDAG::getNode(unsigned int, const llvm::SDLoc&, llvm::EVT, llvm::SDValue, llvm::SDValue, llvm::SDValue, llvm::SDNodeFlags): Assertion `N1.getOpcode() != ISD::DELETED_NODE && N2.getOpcode() != ISD::DELETED_NODE && N3.getOpcode() != ISD::DELETED_NODE && "Operand is DELETED_NODE!"' failed.
Stack dump:
0.	Program arguments: ./build/bin/llc -o - /testcases/llvm-gh-138944/input/poc.ll
1.	Running pass 'Function Pass Manager' on module '/testcases/llvm-gh-138944/input/poc.ll'.
2.	Running pass 'X86 DAG->DAG Instruction Selection' on function '@_Z3foo4fVec'

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

Invoking: `viewcode` with `{'path': 'llvm/lib/CodeGen/SelectionDAG/SelectionDAG.cpp', 'start_line': 7785, 'end_line': 7795}`
responded: I'll analyze this LLVM error report and create a patch to fix the issue. Let me start by examining the error and the relevant code.

The error message indicates an assertion failure in `SelectionDAG.cpp` at line 7789, where the assertion checks that operands are not `DELETED_NODE`. Let me first look at the problematic code:

message.name: viewcode

messages.message:
Invoking: `locate` with `{'symbol': 'X86TargetLowering::getNegatedExpression'}`
responded: Now let me look at the stack trace more carefully. The issue seems to be coming from the X86 target lowering code, specifically from `getNegatedExpression`. Let me examine that function:

message.name: viewcode
message.result:
Here is the code snippet from line 54716 to line 54755 in llvm/lib/Target/X86/X86ISelLowering.cpp:
54716|   case X86ISD::FMSUB_RND:
54717|   case X86ISD::FNMADD_RND:
54718|   case X86ISD::FNMSUB_RND: {
54719|     if (!Op.hasOneUse() || !Subtarget.hasAnyFMA() || !isTypeLegal(VT) ||
54720|         !(SVT == MVT::f32 || SVT == MVT::f64) ||
54721|         !isOperationLegal(ISD::FMA, VT))
54722|       break;
54723| 
54724|     // Don't fold (fneg (fma (fneg x), y, (fneg z))) to (fma x, y, z)
54725|     // if it may have signed zeros.
54726|     if (!Flags.hasNoSignedZeros())
54727|       break;
54728| 
54729|     // This is always negatible for free but we might be able to remove some
54730|     // extra operand negations as well.
54731|     SmallVector<SDValue, 4> NewOps(Op.getNumOperands(), SDValue());
54732|     for (int i = 0; i != 3; ++i)
54733|       NewOps[i] = getCheaperNegatedExpression(
54734|           Op.getOperand(i), DAG, LegalOperations, ForCodeSize, Depth + 1);
54735| 
54736|     bool NegA = !!NewOps[0];
54737|     bool NegB = !!NewOps[1];
54738|     bool NegC = !!NewOps[2];
54739|     unsigned NewOpc = negateFMAOpcode(Opc, NegA != NegB, NegC, true);
54740| 
54741|     Cost = (NegA || NegB || NegC) ? NegatibleCost::Cheaper
54742|                                   : NegatibleCost::Neutral;
54743| 
54744|     // Fill in the non-negated ops with the original values.
54745|     for (int i = 0, e = Op.getNumOperands(); i != e; ++i)
54746|       if (!NewOps[i])
54747|         NewOps[i] = Op.getOperand(i);
54748|     return DAG.getNode(NewOpc, SDLoc(Op), VT, NewOps);
54749|   }
54750|   case X86ISD::FRCP:
54751|     if (SDValue NegOp0 =
54752|             getNegatedExpression(Op.getOperand(0), DAG, LegalOperations,
54753|                                  ForCodeSize, Cost, Depth + 1))
54754|       return DAG.getNode(Opc, SDLoc(Op), VT, NegOp0);
54755|     break;

                ArrayRef<SDValue> Ops)
3. variable NewOpc

Type: unsigned int
Passed as Opcode

// In X86TargetLowering::getNegatedExpression
unsigned int NewOpc = negateFMAOpcode(Opc, NegA != NegB, NegC, true)
4. class SDLoc
provided by "llvm/CodeGen/SelectionDAGNodes.h"

Wrapper class for IR location info (IR ordering and DebugLoc) to be passed into SDNode creation functions.
When an SDNode is created from the DAGBuilder, the DebugLoc is extracted from the original Instruction, and IROrder is the ordinal position of the instruction.
When an SDNode is created after the DAG is being built, both DebugLoc and the IROrder are propagated from the original SDNode.
So SDLoc class provides two constructors besides the default one, one to be used by the DAGBuilder, the other to be used by others.

// In namespace llvm
class SDLoc {}
5. constructor SDLoc
provided by "llvm/CodeGen/SelectionDAGNodes.h"

- const SDValue V
Passed as DL (converted to const SDLoc &)

Passed as VT

// In X86TargetLowering::getNegatedExpression
EVT VT = Op.getValueType()
8. variable NewOps

Type: SmallVector<SDValue, 4>
Passed by const reference as Ops (converted to ArrayRef<SDValue>)
This is always negatible for free but we might be able to remove some extra operand negations as well.

messages.message:
Invoking: `viewcode` with `{'path': 'llvm/include/llvm/CodeGen/TargetLowering.h', 'start_line': 4545, 'end_line': 4565}`
responded: Now I understand the issue. The problem is that `getCheaperNegatedExpression` can return an invalid `SDValue` (which would have a null node or a deleted node), but the code in `X86ISelLowering.cpp` doesn't check for this before using the returned values in `NewOps`.

Let me look at the `getCheaperOrNeutralNegatedExpression` function to see what it returns:

messages.message:
Invoking: `locate` with `{'symbol': 'getOpcode'}`
responded: Good! I can see that `SDValue` has an explicit `operator bool()` that returns `Node != nullptr` (line 175-177). So the check `if (!NewOps[i])` should work correctly.

But let me check if there's another issue. Let me look at the `getOpcode()` method to understand when it might return `ISD::DELETED_NODE`:
